demo.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a recording containing an example of someone’s music that is sent to a record company so that they can decide whether to produce it or not
demo.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an event at which a large group of people publicly protest about something
demo.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: an explanation of how something works
demo.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: an example of a product that is used to show what it is like or how it works
demo.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: demo homes on the new development
demo.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a computer program that shows what a new piece of software will be able to do when it is ready to be sold
demo.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Click here to download a demo of the new version of our personal finance software.
demo.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to show or explain how something works or is done, especially new computer equipment
demo.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: They’re going to demo some of the new software at this year’s Mac convention.
demo.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a computer program that shows customers what a new piece of software will be able to do when it is ready to be sold, to encourage them to buy the complete form of the software
